intro: Randia urcelliformis, commonly known as the spiny randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small white or pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Randia urcelliformis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
